intro: Otophylla, commonly known as the earleaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf shape, which often resembles an ear, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. Otophylla species produce small, daisy-like flowers that are usually yellow or white in color. These plants are often found in regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico.
